TopicTitle: First Minmus Miner not producing ore <Answered>

Articles.Content:
Hi All,

For the first time in KSP I have stuck with a career game and got as far as mining. So I did my research, read the help and re-purposed my first Minmus base design to some mining. So I have accepted a mission to  take 1050 ore from Minmus and pop it into Kerbin orbit. 

http://imgur.com/gallery/3Dt6MjG

As you can see, I have power, radiators, Ore tanks and ISRU.

But when I fire up the drill, it says "Ore Full" even though have 1200 spare capacity.

Any ideas on what has gone horribly, horribly wrong? 

 

Thanks,

 

P

Edited May 17, 2016 by scola_p

Hm, that pic isn't enough to be sure. The only things I can think are:

  1. Your ore tanks are actually full. You don't show the ship resources window so I can't tell for sure. I put it here just for completeness.
  2. Your ore tanks are disabled. They'll have little red Xs next to the slider-like bar that shows how full they are if this is the case.
  3. A mod has modified the way ore tanks work or something like that. I can't help you there.
  4. You've found a bug

I'm sure there are more, but that's all I can think of right now.

And they were disabled.

Who knew that they would be off by default!

Thanks for your help!!

P

37 minutes ago, scola_p said:

And they were disabled.

Who knew that they would be off by default!

Thanks for your help!!

P

No problem! Though they're not off by default in stock. Either you accidentally disabled them at some point, or maybe there was some weird mod interaction that did it.
